info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 8:28AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A THUNDERSTORM WITH INTENSE LIGHTNING WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN RABUN...SOUTHEASTERN MACON...SOUTHWESTERN TRANSYLVANIA...SOUTHEASTERN JACKSON AND NORTH CENTRAL OCONEE COUNTIES UNTIL 930 AM EDT... At 828 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with intense lightning 19 miles north of Walhalla, or 5 miles west of Gorges State Park, moving northeast at 20 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Highlands, Cashiers, Lake Toxaway, Lake Glenville, Gorges State Park, Sky Valley, Lake Jocassee, Balsam Grove, Bad Creek and Wolf Mountain. In addition to intense lightning, very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters. Frequent lightning is occurring with this storm. If outdoors, try to get indoors or into a hard topped vehicle. Otherwise, stay away from open areas and isolated high objects such as trees. When indoors, stay away from windows and doors and avoid using wired electronic devices. Do not take a shower or bath. Try to unplug unnecessary appliances before the storm approaches.
